channel.title: Transfer Methods?
channel.description:
As you all know, free trade is coming back, so im going to be botting non stop on froob accounts, and tradem to my main account, now my question is, Jagex for sure is going to be watching people who trade tons of money to each other for nothing, and probably ban them, any of you guys have some methods of transferring to lower suspicion?
I have an idea, but this is all i came up with:
Me: I am quitting this stupid game, giving away my money little by little!
*Noob trades, give him 30k, another trades, gives him 60k, another trades, gives 100k*
Me: NOW FOR THE BIG ONE, GIVING AWAY (lets say in this case, 10m) 10M AWAY, MY LAST STACKO CASH!!!!
*My main happens to stroll by or is in the give away, but was unsuccessful to get any cash yet*
Me: *Directed to main* You look like a trust worthy person, not a nooby low level, promise me to keep my money safe, worked hard on it, *Gives me money, noobs cry and quit the game*
I know its a bit cheesy, but do you guys think it will work? And got any other ideas/methods?

item.title: Transfer Methods?
item.dc:creator: @Knightraider Knightraider
item.description:
@Knightraider wrote:

People got found out from RWT because they most likely were flagged for botting before they traded the gold and Jagex was waiting to ban both accounts whether they were RWT or moving the gold onto the main.

Read full topic

item.title: Transfer Methods?
item.description:
@4_2_0 wrote:

[quote=“Knightraider, post:44, topic:379449”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=475293.msg3478523#msg3478523 date=1295903557]

Or just have a different ip trade to another ip and then your main account kills that person and takes all the cash.

chances are if you are taking a pile of cash into the wild they will be doing some sort of automated investigation. Best Transfer method I can think of is going to the dual arena and staking it. However if the mule is not near your current combat level it may again be looked at.
[/quote]
Hardly. Do you have any idea how much space it would take to keep a log of duels into the millions - Including what was staked - What levels the players are ect. Not only that by the time they have investigated your claim more and more duels have been made. They DONT log stakes they have the staff nor space to do that.

Runescape isn’t a private server with 100 people on it.[/quote]

Ok. I know jagex’s fight against RWT trading wasn’t too successful, until all the new updates, but think about it I know not everyone did, but a lot of people got banned for trading.

Do you understand that people trade a vastly amount more then they duel. And YET, Jagex was still able to find RWT’s. Your saying they don’t keep a duel log because of the large amount of stakes, but think of the trade amount, and yet they still were able to catch people.

I believe you sir are wrong, they record based on certain criteria, I just don’t know what.

Read full topic

item.title: Transfer Methods?
item.dc:creator: @Knightraider Knightraider
item.description:
@Knightraider wrote:

I bot myself, I am planning to do the staking method. I’d recommend it.

If you got OCD bout your account security I’d funnel the money through different accounts before it reaches your main.

Read full topic

item.title: Transfer Methods?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

I read through the comments, and your comment interested me, knight.

Are you recommending that i do it that way? Because if they dont keep a log for that… then thats awesome! but i’ll need to get the stats up on the botting account or something… na…

Read full topic

item.title: Transfer Methods?
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

Mr Mopar X:

They didn’t remove free trade and unrestricted wilderness because of players transferring gold between their accounts, they did it to stop people from profiting off their game through real world trading. Mod MMG said in his clan chat that players trading items between accounts they own is the least of their worries, not to mention how he believes that it shouldn’t be against the rules.

How do they differentiate between one person trading between his two accounts and one person giving purchased gold to another? Seems like they would just ban both sense they are both against the rules currently and just in case it was a RWT.

Read full topic

item.title: Transfer Methods?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:31, topic:379449”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=475293.msg3478676#msg3478676 date=1295911949]

Or just have a different ip trade to another ip and then your main account kills that person and takes all the cash.

chances are if you are taking a pile of cash into the wild they will be doing some sort of automated investigation. Best Transfer method I can think of is going to the dual arena and staking it. However if the mule is not near your current combat level it may again be looked at.

I don’t think they really care enough/that much tbh.
[/quote]
I am sure they care or else they would not remove it its not like they had ‘save’ runescape they have another MMORPG coming out that will take many of runescape players away.[/quote]
Well, then I guess all the appeals would be somewhere near “My brother is quitting Runescape and is giving me all his wealth.” or something of the sort?

Read full topic

item.title: Transfer Methods?
item.dc:creator: @abatssk8ter abatssk8ter
item.description:
@abatssk8ter wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:26, topic:379449”]Chances are they are looking for if you have been friends with the person that’s giving you the multitudes of cash, and for how long you’ve been friends, etc. They keep bragging about these new systems and ways of detecting illegitimate trading between players, to detect RWT or mules, etc. The only criteria I could think up that would identify such a trade is if it’s some random player trading to a more prestigious account a very large stack of money. Obviously this would apply to drop trading, random staking, and random pking as well.

Hmm, most undetectable trade method I can come up with would be having some sort of mule account that’s both connected from a different IP, and whom you’ve been “friends” with for at least 1-2 months. You trade all your botting profits to that account, wait a week or two, then trade it over to your main account. Don’t make any of the accounts look obvious. Granted, this is all based on several speculations I have, so it could be totally what Jagex is looking for or a decent method of bypassing their system, no way to really know unless you try it someday.[/quote]Chances are you’re not going to get caught…

Read full topic

item.title: Transfer Methods?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Chances are they are looking for if you have been friends with the person that’s giving you the multitudes of cash, and for how long you’ve been friends, etc. They keep bragging about these new systems and ways of detecting illegitimate trading between players, to detect RWT or mules, etc. The only criteria I could think up that would identify such a trade is if it’s some random player trading to a more prestigious account a very large stack of money. Obviously this would apply to drop trading, random staking, and random pking as well.

Hmm, most undetectable trade method I can come up with would be having some sort of mule account that’s both connected from a different IP, and whom you’ve been “friends” with for at least 1-2 months. You trade all your botting profits to that account, wait a week or two, then trade it over to your main account. Don’t make any of the accounts look obvious. Granted, this is all based on several speculations I have, so it could be totally what Jagex is looking for or a decent method of bypassing their system, no way to really know unless you try it someday.

Read full topic
